results.title: Special treatment: locking up aboriginal children
results.creator_credit: Smith Street Films and Margaret Anne Smith
results.brief_description: Young Aboriginal people are no longer removed from their families by the authorities “for their own good”, but young Aborigines are still subject to forcible removal from their families and friends through imprisonment in juvenile prisons for petty crimes. This program focuses on the experiences of young Aborigines in New South Wales who tell of a high degree of police harassment, simply because they are black. Their views are in stark contrast to those held by the white law enforcers interviewed, who see themselves to be free of racism despite the fact that there is a massive over-representation of Aborigines in Australian prisons.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Smith Street Films and Margaret Anne Smith

results.title: Special trade
results.brief_description: A story about a friendship between a young girl and her grandfather. As a baby, the young girl was taken for outings and taught to walk by her grandfather. Then, one day he returns home from the hospital in a wheelchair and it is the young girl’s turn to take her grandfather for walks. Based on the book entitled “Special Trade” by Sally Whitman.

results.title: Special effects in Blade Runner (Spinners)
results.brief_description: Blade runner Rick Deckard (Harrison Ford) hunts rogue replicants through the rain-drenched, neon-lit streets of a futuristic Los Angeles in Ridley Scott’s groundbreaking Blade Runner (1982).

constellations_primary.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_primary.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

results.description:
Blade runner Rick Deckard (Harrison Ford) hunts rogue replicants through the rain-drenched, neon-lit streets of a futuristic Los Angeles in Ridley Scott’s groundbreaking Blade Runner (1982).   

Aside from the influential dystopian setting, Blade Runner is lauded for its striking visual effects, particularly the ‘spinners’ – hi-tech cars that soar through the streets and the sky. Scott was inspired by imagery in several of these books. Futurist and industrial designer Syd Mead also contributed, helping design the sci-fi world around the cars.   

Spinner models were filmed against a black screen and then superimposed on the model shots of LA. Three life-size versions of the spinners were also created. These flew on wires that were later painted out of the shots, while interior shots were filmed against a green screen.
description_for_label:
Blade runner Rick Deckard (Harrison Ford) hunts rogue replicants through the rain-drenched, neon-lit streets of a futuristic Los Angeles in Ridley Scott’s groundbreaking Blade Runner (1982).   

Aside from the influential dystopian setting, Blade Runner is lauded for its striking visual effects, particularly the ‘spinners’ – hi-tech cars that soar through the streets and the sky. Scott was inspired by imagery in several of these books. Futurist and industrial designer Syd Mead also contributed, helping design the sci-fi world around the cars.   

Spinner models were filmed against a black screen and then superimposed on the model shots of LA. Three life-size versions of the spinners were also created. These flew on wires that were later painted out of the shots, while interior shots were filmed against a green screen.
